details.purpose: To record detailed findings about colorectal cancer found on microscopic histopathological examination.
details.use: To record detailed findings about microscopic examination of tissue related to colorecal cancer. Use as a component archetype in the context of a suite of archetypes that make up a histopathology report i.e. OBSERVATION.lab_test.histopathology and CLUSTER.macroscopy.colorectal_carcinoma.
details.misuse: Not designed to be used within any other archetype other than OBSERVATION.lab_test.histopathology.

description.other_contributors: Koray Atalag, University of Auckland, New Zealand
description.other_details:
College of American Pathologists. Protocol for the Examination of Specimens from Patients with Primary Carcinomas of the Colon and Rectum [Internet]. 2009 Mar ;[cited 2009 Jul 28 ] Available from: http://www.cap.org/apps/docs/committees/cancer/cancer_protocols/2008/colonrectum08_pw.pdf
Royal College of Pathologists. Dataset for colorectal cancer (2nd edition) [Internet]. 2007 Dec 4;[cited 2009 Jul 29 ] Available from: http://www.rcpath.org/index.asp?PageID=1153
Royal College of Pathologists of Australasia. Colorectal Cancer Structured Reporting Protocol (1st Edition 2010). [Internet]. 2010;[cited 2010 Mar 21 ] Available from: http://www.rcpa.edu.au//static/File/Asset%20library/public%20documents/Publications/StructuredReporting/COLORECTAL%20CANCER%20STRUCTURED%20REPORTING%20PROTOCOL%20for%20web.pdf

items.description: Microscopic anatomical pathology findings related to colorectal cancer.
Findings related to the involvement of tumour in lymph nodes.
Findings related to the involvement of tumour in lymph nodes.
Additional histopathological findings.
A text description of additional findings.
Direct invasion of local tissue by tumour.
Findings related to surgical resection margins.
Details of a single surgical resection margin.
A single additional histopathological finding.
Findings of in-situ carcinoma.
Findings related to in-situ carcinoma.
In-situ carcinoma is present.
In-situ carcinoma is absent.
Presence of in-situ carcinoma has not been determined.
A text description of in-situ carcinoma.
Estimate of the completeness of surgical resection.

Findings of distant metastasis.

Histological grading.

A text comment on histological grading.
Tumour is well differentiated.
Tumour is moderately differentiated.
Distance of nearest involved node to the circumferential margin.
Details of venous (large vessel) invasion by tumour.
Findings related to local tissue invasion by tumour.

Findings of discontinuous extramural tumour deposits.
Discontinuous extramural tumour deposits are present.
Discontinuous extramural tumour deposits are absent.
Presence of discontinuous extramural tumour deposits has not been determined.
Distance from circumferential margin to extramural deposits.
Details of perineural invasion by tumour.
Details of sites of proven distant metastases.
Synchronous carcinoma is present.
Ulcerative colitis is present.
Ulcerative colitis with dysplasia is present.
Crohn's disease is present.
Crohn's disease with dysplasia is present.
No residual tumour - as per AJCC TNM classification 7th Edition.
R1 - as per AJCC TNM classification 7th Edition.
R2 - as per AJCC TNM classification 7th Edition.
Residual tumour cannot be assessed - as per AJCC TNM classification 7th Edition.
An estimate of the response to neoadjuvant therapy. (AJCC score).
Details of the response to neoadjuvant therapy.
A text comment on the response to neoadjuvant therapy.
Local invasion of tumour. Scored using the pT element of the TNM classification.
No evidence of primary tumour.
Tumour invades submucosa.
Tumour invades muscularis propria.
Tumour invades through muscularis propria into subserosa, or into non-peritonealised pericolic or perirectal tissues.
Tumour directly invades other organs or structures.
Tumour perforates visceral peritoneum.
Primary tumour cannot be assessed.
The subdivision of pT3 that applies to the tumour.
Minimal invasion: <1 mm beyond the border of the muscularis propria.
Slight invasion: 1-5 mm beyond the border of the muscularis propria.
Moderate invasion: >5 mm and <= 15mm beyond the border of the muscularis propria.
Extensive invasion: > 15 mm beyond the border of the muscularis propria.
Distance of tumour invasion beyond the muscularis propria.
An estimate of nodal involvement using the pN element of TNM classification.
No regional lymph node metastasis.
Metastasis in 1-3 regional lymph nodes.
Metastasis in 4 or more regional lymph nodes.
An estimate of the response to neoadjuvant therapy. (CAP) College of American Pathologists.
Has neoadjuvant therapy been given?
Neoadjuvant therapy has been given.
Neoadjuvant therapy has not been given.
It is not known if neoadjuvant therapy has been given.
An estimate of the response to neoadjuvant therapy. (RCP) Royal College of Pathologists (UK).
